#Text=The San Antonio Spurs defeated the struggling Memphis Grizzlies , 104 - 95 , at AT & T Center on Wednesday evening .
#Text=The Spurs ( 14 - 7 ) have excelled despite the absence of superstar wing Kawhi Leonard .
#Text=The two - time Defensive Player of the Year has been sidelined all season with a quad injury , but the Spurs have still won 10 of their last 13 games .
#Text=A huge part of San Antonio 's success has been veteran All-Star LaMarcus Aldridge , who is posting his best numbers as a Spur , with averages of over 22 points and eight rebounds per game .
#Text=On Wednesday , that trend continued in a major way , as Aldridge scored a season - high 41 points to lead the team .
#Text=The big man was simply lights out from the field , shooting 17 - of - 24 and 3 - of - 3 from beyond the arc .
#Text=Aldridge was the undeniable focal point of the team 's offensive attack , as no other Spur scored more than 13 or attempted more than eight shots .
#Text=While Aldridge was the engine of San Antonio 's offense , strong team defense helped them earn the homecourt win .
#Text=The Spurs forced 17 Memphis turnovers , including nine which came off steals .
#Text=San Antonio played with immense discipline , sending Memphis to the line only 16 times while shooting 24 free - throws of its own .
#Text=Memphis ( 7 - 13 ) also has an injured star , but has been trending in the opposite direction of San Antonio .
#Text=The Grizzlies have now lost nine straight games and remain without veteran point guard Mike Conley , who is sidelined indefinitely with Achilles discomfort .
#Text=Amidst the team 's free - fall , head coach David Fizdale was fired , leaving assistant coach J.B.
#Text=Bickerstaff to take the reigns until a replacement is named .
#Text=Bickerstaff 's tenure did not get off to a promising start , as the team struggled to put up points on Wednesday despite a solid shooting night .
#Text=The team shot 46 percent from the field and went an admirable 11 - of - 22 from beyond the three - point line .
#Text=Still , the Grizzlies were unable to reach 100 points on the night , and the team saw only two players score more than 13 points .
#Text=The high scorer was veteran ball - handler Tyreke Evans , who has seen a minor career resurgence this season , even amidst the Grizzlies ' struggles .

#Text=The former Rookie of the Year winner scored 22 points on Wednesday , now averaging 18 points per game on impressive shooting splits of 49 percent from the field and 42 percent from three - point territory .
#Text=Evans , who started the year as a sixth man , has slid comfortably into the starting lineup in Conley 's absence .
#Text=He provided a valuable offensive spark on Wednesday .
#Text=The two teams will rematch in Memphis on Friday night .
